At least someone remembers them, they  were really fun and added some flavour to the boots not just picking attack speed boots for adc and magic penetration for mages etc. ; - ;
{{sticker:sg-janna}}

It got removed because no one ever bought anything other than Homeguards, with the very rare exception of Alacrity. Since people only bought Homeguards they just made that a game mechanic instead and removed the boot enchantments.

Boot enchants were removed months after homeguard became a game mechanic. They said the moment Homeguard became a game mechanic, the rest of the boot enchants just enforced movespeed creep (which was kind of true, but imo it wasn't a reason to axe the entire system), because of how 'warping' Alacrity was and how Furor and Captain would have taken its place had Alacrity been the only one to be removed. Apparently in their eyes, Distortion was the only healthy one which is why it ended up being merged with Ghost.

I wish the entire system didn't get the boot (heh) over that, but they did say the enchants could come back if they can figure out how to do them without enforcing MS creep, which hasn't happened as of yet.

They could easily add more enchantments in that don't just give movement speed.  Some examples:

Weighted - knockups and knockbacks are reduced by 30%

Pocketed (incompatible with predator) - you can put consumables in your boots

Springy (incompatible with predator) - adds a small dash active like protobelt that can't go through walls

Well fit - gain 250 health

Arcane - gain 300 mana

Refreshing - allows you to instantly respawn once every x minutes (something like 8 minutes)

1: Adding "Weighted" to combat knockups would be like adding "true resist" to combat true damage.
2: Springy would potentially warp the game, making juggernauts able to flank through a wall.
3: Refreshing would be perhaps the biggest snowball buff we've seen in a while.  The winning team would hardly ever have it on cooldown while the losing team would be using it pretty much off cooldown.  In those rare situations where the losing team turns it around, they won't even be able to pick up more than an outer turret because they don't have more than a few seconds controlling the map.

I also don't think they want just straight stat bonuses on boot enchants either.
Reread springy.  It specifically says "can't go through walls."  Imagine Aatrox's E but can't get over walls.

Oh thought it said can for some reason haha.

In that case it would mostly be worthless.  Unless you could use it during animations to change where you hit, I can't imagine anyone using it.
I would take it on Taric to land his stun.
Imagine if they had an enchantment that allowed you to ignore ally minion collision.
I bought captain on engage tanks and back line supports and furor on auto attacking melees.

There are many things to blame him for, all the iconic things that were in the game before have probably been removed due to casualization.

They were removed because they thought MS creep was getting out of hand, since Homeguard (which was the only viable enchant before it became a global effect) was removed from being a boot enchant and became a global effect.

To be honest, I think it was kind of stupid how fast certain champions could back, Regen, and then return to fight with Homeguard + Captain or Alacrity, but I feel like that could have been 'fixed' by disabling enchantment benefits with Homeguard active.
